esphome.docs:
ESPHome’s Over-The-Air (OTA) platform allows you to remotely install modified/updated firmware binaries onto your ESPHome devices over their network (Wi-Fi or Ethernet) interface.

*See also: [ESPHome OTA Updates](https://esphome.io/components/ota/esphome.html#esphome-ota-updates)*

http_request.docs:
The OTA (Over The Air) via HTTP Request update component allows your devices to install updated firmware on their own. To use it, in your device’s configuration, you specify a URL from which the device will download the binary file (firmware). To trigger the update, an ESPHome [action](https://esphome.io/automations/actions.html#config-action) is used which initiates the download and installation of the new firmware. Once complete, the device is rebooted, invoking the new firmware.

*See also: [OTA Update via HTTP Request](https://esphome.io/components/ota/http_request.html#ota-update-via-http-request)*
